title: Biden’s Confrontation With Netanyahu Had Been Brewing for Years
description: The president’s decision to publicly criticize Israel is highly unusual for a leader who has pledged not to interfere in the country’s domestic politics.

title: Soldiers Massing Near Ukrainian Nuclear Plant, U.N. Official Warns
description: Amid signs of offensives and counteroffensives, concern is rekindling about what it will mean for the biggest nuclear plant in Europe.

title: Supreme Court Considers a Mercenary’s Confession and the Confrontation Clause
description: In the case of a murder in the Philippines, the justices weighed whether relaying a confession that implicated another crossed a constitutional line.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: How Modi Wields Power
description: Also, a plea for a pause on A.I. and a U.N. resolution on climate lawsuits.

title: Putin’s top security adviser holds talks with India’s prime minister as Moscow seeks closer ties.
description: The Russian envoy was accompanied by a Russian oil executive, who signed new deals with India.

title: Ukraine Says It Will Use Legal Means to Evict Orthodox Pro-Russia Monks
description: Representatives of the monks and priests have vowed to ignore an eviction order.

title: Modi Tightens Grip on India’s Democracy, Wielding the Judiciary
description: The ouster from Parliament of India’s best-known opposition leader shows how Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party is manipulating the judiciary, critics say.

title: AstraZeneca’s Covid Vaccine May Have Posed a Higher Heart Risk for Young Women, Study Shows
description: A new analysis examined deaths in Britain, where the company’s product was restricted in 2021 because of safety concerns.

title: Amsterdam Has a Message for Male Tourists From the U.K.: ‘Stay Away’
description: In an ad campaign aimed at British men between 18 and 35, the Dutch capital threatens fines for visitors who are looking for a “messy night.”

title: Israeli Crisis Shows How Protests Can, and Can’t, Force Change
description: What does it take for a mass movement to translate public anger into political results?  Leverage.

title: Yang Bing-yi, Who Brought Soup Dumplings to the World, Dies at 96
description: Starting with a modest shop in Taiwan in 1958, he built Din Tai Fung into a global dumpling and noodle empire, earning a Michelin star along the way.

title: Pope Francis, 86, Enters a Hospital for Tests
description: The Vatican said the medical tests were planned, but it did not describe the tests or say how long he might stay.

title: Vanuatu Strikes a Blow for Climate Justice
description: Vanuatu, a disaster-prone Pacific country, has secured United Nations approval to take that question to the International Court of Justice.

title: Even as U.S. Beckons, European Leaders Head to Beijing
description: China is trying to improve relations with the European Union just as the United States is pushing the bloc to pick sides.

title: DNA Confirms Oral History of Swahili People
description: A genetic analysis of dozens of ancient skeletons from East Africa helps pin down the origins of coastal Swahili society.

title: King Charles Arrives in Berlin for First State Visit as Monarch
description: Charles and Camilla, the queen consort, visited the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin to start their three-day trip to Germany.

title: The head of the U.N.’s nuclear watchdog arrives at Ukraine’s embattled Zaporizhzhia plant.
8 European Leaders Urge Big Tech to Stop Disinformation Amid Russia’s War in Ukraine
description: An open letter from eight prime ministers calls on leaders of companies including Meta to take action “against disinformation that undermines our peace and stability.”

title: Obamacare Keeps Winning
description: Its North Carolina victory is a sign of larger changes.

title: Head of U.N.’s Nuclear Group Details Risks at Ukrainian Plant
description: Rafael Mariano Grossi of the International Atomic Energy Agency is set to visit the Zaporizhzhia nuclear facility, which has been shelled several times. Here is what we’re covering:

title: How Ukraine’s Battered Steel Industry Galvanized Its War Effort
description: The iron- and steel-producing factories of Ukraine’s rust belt have made body armor, helmets and armored plates for vehicles — and steelworkers risked their lives rolling out heavy machinery at the beginning of the war to help physically block the Russian advance.

title: The Yankees Cap Goes Viral in Brazil: ‘Is It Basketball?’
description: The New York Yankees logo is everywhere in Brazil. What it means, however, is up for interpretation.

title: The Incredible Challenge of Counting Every Global Birth and Death
description: In rural Colombia, as in many parts of the world, tallying births and deaths is one of the most desperately needed public-health measures. It’s a lot harder than it sounds.

title: U.S.-Israel Tensions Over Judicial Overhaul Burst Into Open
description: In response to sharp criticism by President Biden, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that Israel would make its own decisions.

title: Taiwan’s President Heads to the U.S., Bracing for China’s Retaliation
description: President Tsai Ing-wen is expected to meet Speaker Kevin McCarthy next week, risking a show of force from Beijing, which opposes any such exchanges.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Russia bombards a town near Bakhmut.

title: Myanmar’s Military Regime Disbands Aung San Suu Kyi’s Political Party
description: The junta has dissolved dozens of opposition parties ahead of the next general election, including the popular National League for Democracy.
